questions.question: How do you like to pace your park day?

knowledgeCard.title: Park Day Pacing
knowledgeCard.content: A typical Disney/Universal day can be 10-14 hours of walking in Florida heat. The parks are huge! Magic Kingdom alone has over 25 attractions. Some families power through with a strict schedule; others take it slow with pool breaks. Both are valid â€” the key is knowing everyone's style.

questions.question: How much are you comfortable spending per day (food, souvenirs, extras)?

knowledgeCard.title: Daily Spending at the Parks
knowledgeCard.content: Quick service meals run $12-18 per person. Table service is $25-50+. Snacks (turkey legs, Dole Whip, churros) are $6-12. Souvenirs range widely â€” a t-shirt is $25-40, a lightsaber build is $250. Water is free at counter service restaurants (ask for ice water)!

questions.question: Are you okay splitting up from the group sometimes?

knowledgeCard.title: Splitting Up Strategy
knowledgeCard.content: Families often split into groups based on thrill tolerance. Rider Swap lets parents trade off on rides while someone stays with young kids â€” no re-waiting! Having a plan for splitting up (with meetup times/places) actually makes everyone happier.
